abstracts.cdata!:
The Decentralized, Planning and
            Financing Project for Mozambique aims to develop public
            sector capacity for district planning and plan
            implementation that is accountable, and develop capacity
            among rural communities to effectively participate in
            district planning and ensure local administration
            accountability for plan implementation. The following
            summarizes potential environmental impacts of civil works.
            The monitoring plans encompass the following categories:
            surface water drainage; Sewerage and sanitation; water
            supply and management; small-scale irrigation; waste
            disposal; electrification; road works and bridges
            (construction and rehabilitation of feeder tertiary roads
            only). Some of the mitigating measures will include to
            ensure that drain gradients are created to optimize water
            flow velocity to avoid ponding and water velocity-driven
            erosion; keep drains clear of debris; promote awareness
            campaigns focusing on adverse health impacts; design a waste
            management strategy; cover waste and burns as soon as
            possible after dumping; establish a routine maintenance and
            cleaning service; install water reservoirs with enough
            capacity; and regulate the use of wastewater for irrigation.
